div.span: Shelby County R-IV Schools and Shelby County Health Department Dental Partnership

div.div:
Dear Parent/Guardian:
Dental Clinic staff from the Lincoln County Health Department (LCHD), in partnership with the Shelby County Health Department, will be offering dental services at your child’s school. Students (with parent permission) will receive an oral health exam, xrays, cleaning, fluoride application, and dental sealants. These services are important to prevent tooth decay, and are recommended by the American Dental Association.
Depending on each child’s individual needs, these services may need to be done in 2 visits with our dental staff at the school.
In order to provide these preventative services at no out-of-pocket cost to families, the health department asks for insurance information. This allows us to bill insurance plans when possible. Donations are also appreciated, to help offset the cost of providing these services to uninsured community members.
Parents/guardians will receive a copy of the health screening form along with referral information for dentists in the Shelby County area. Health department staff will be calling families to talk about the results of dental exams, to answer questions, and help with plans for follow-up care. If follow-up care is requested to be done by our dental staff, fees for these services will be discussed with you during this call. Please see the attached brochure for more information, or call the LCHD Dental Clinic at 636-528-6117, option 3.
LCHD staff will begin serving students in the South Shelby School District beginning in February. It may take several days to see all students, and staff will be at the school until all students are seen. If you would like your child to receive these services, you must provide permission for each service offered, and complete all required paperwork attached. Exams are required for any students receiving a dental cleaning. Permission Slips are available at school building offices.
PAPERWORK CAN ALSO BE COMPLETED ONLINE AT www.lchdmo.org/dental-forms

span.data-emptytext: Shelby County R-IV School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value:
Students, parents of elementary and secondary school student, employees, applicants for admission and employment and sources of referral of applicants for admission and employment with the Shelby County R-IV School District are hereby notified that this institution does not discriminate on the basis of sex or handicap in admission, access to, treatment, or employment in its programs and activities.
Any person having inquiries concerning Shelby County R-IV School District's compliance with the regulations implementing Title IX or Section 504 is directed to contact the Superintendent Office at (573) 588-4961.

p.span:
Students, parents of elementary and secondary school student, employees, applicants for admission and employment and sources of referral of applicants for admission and employment with the Shelby County R-IV School District are hereby notified that this institution does not discriminate on the basis of sex or handicap in admission, access to, treatment, or employment in its programs and activities.
Any person having inquiries concerning Shelby County R-IV School District's compliance with the regulations implementing Title IX or Section 504 is directed to contact the Superintendent Office at (573) 588-4961.

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
